channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bags of swept up leaves left for weeks, 8th February
item.description:
Street cleaners have swept and bagged up leaves / debris from the pavements but the bags have not been collected so there are several bags left on the pavement. They have been here for 2 weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, Norwood Park Road, West Norwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Fly tipping, 8th February
item.description:
Next door neighbours left fridge and cot mattress outside my house in a parking space. They were told to move it onto their drive and then moved it and left it up the road on the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Okehampton Crescent, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox on path just inside Oxleas Wood, 8th February
item.description:
There is a dead fox on a path leading into Oxleas Wood. The path is directly opposite Bus Stop 'Z' on Welling Way (B15 stop). The entrance to the path is behind the parking sign that is on the opposite side of the road from the bus stop.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Welling Way, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked roadside gulley, 8th February
item.description:
Reported Friday 8852321. Received email this morning fixed. Investigation shows now it’s stopped raining the water has slowly drained away. The gulley however needs cleaning out as every time it rains it overflows into the road. Look at the silt around the drain cover and curb.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Halfway Street, Longlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pigeons fouling, 8th February
item.description:
Residents of Gainsborough Studios including myself have been experiencing an issue with pigeons heavily fouling our balconies, — something we haven’t had before and I’ve been living here for 20 years.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Poole Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Salt box cover has fallen, 8th February
item.description:
Salt box cover has fallen. This poses a risk as it’s a heavy foot traffic around this area and someone has put it back on top but it’s not secure. It’s a heavy cover so when it falls it might fall on someone foot, child or dog.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Broadlands Road, Sundridge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Opposite 94 Agamemnon Road, 8th February
item.description:
This tree is now touching our house during windy days. It is causing our roof tiles to turn green (see two comparative photos). The leaves and seeds are blocking our guttering. I have been in touch before and told the tree will be pruned but when is this going to happen? Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ajax Road, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nails, broken accident vechile pieces in my driveway ( 113 St Paul’s wood hill Br5 2ss), 8th February
item.description:
Last night, there was a serious accident in front of my driveway. The van has now been removed, however broken pieces and nails remain on my driveway. This is dangerous for both pedestrians and vehicles, and it is currently unsafe for me to take my vehicle out. I would be grateful if arrangements could be made as soon as possible to clear the debris. Thank you for your assistance.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 113, St Paul's Wood Hill, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
